title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the short title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges as defined in section 2(a)(4). Tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions are defined by the Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978 and the Tribal College Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions have SEC. 3 land grant status. The Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College shall be considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. The applicability of related provisions includes any provision of any Act. The applicability of related provisions of any Act relating to the operation or assistance to land-grant colleges in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern Mariana Islands shall apply to the land-grant colleges and institutions described in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of appropriations: In lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions. Authorization of appropriations: In lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land script for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts, there is authorized to be appropriated $10,000,000 to such tribal colleges and institutions. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be held and considered. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be granted to colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of the Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land script. The Act may be cited as the "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" and defines certain provisions. The "1994 Institutions" referred to in this Act include various colleges such as Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, and others. The list of tribal colleges includes Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Any provision of Congress relating to land-grant colleges applies to 1994 Institutions, with some exceptions. The Act of Congress applies to land-grant colleges, with exceptions for agricultural research colleges eligible for funds under specific Acts. $23,000,000 is authorized for 1994 Institutions instead of extending provisions for donations of public land or land scrip. $23,000,000 is authorized for 1994 Institutions for the benefit of agriculture and mechanic arts, subject to provisions of the Act applicable to proceeds from land sales or land scrip. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide funding for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 authorized for each fiscal year starting from 1995. The funds will be paid to the treasurer of the 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide funding for 1994 Institutions in Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Guam through a competitive applications process. There shall be no matching requirement for funds made available under this section. SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. The Research Facilities Act is amended to provide $1,700,000 for grants to 1994 Institutions for construction, acquisition, and remodeling of buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
